author: Asif Yar Khan
text:
Violence erupted on the Osmania University campus on Wednesday after the body of a man was found in a water sump near the main library building. Thinking that it was a suicide of a student, many students assembled and raised slogans against the government and later pelted stones. Police reached the spot and dispersed the students. Many students were injured in the lathi charge. Thirteen policemen were treated for simple injuries.

A few students found the decomposed body and alerted college officials. Soon, a large crowd gathered at the place. In no time student leaders arrived at the place and stated that the body was that of a university student who had committed suicide as he could not get a government job.

As the news spread, a students gathered at the spot and started raising slogans against the government. Soon, the Osmania University police arrived and tried to take out the body. However, the students prevented the police from shifting the body to the mortuary. The police, with the help of a mobile phone found at the spot and by taking help of the local people, identified the man as B. Silari Babu (20), a labourer.

“The man was missing since March 21. In the morning, his body was found in the tank, we are investigating how he died,” DCP (east) Dr. V. Ravinder said.

The students were in no mood to allow the police to shift the body to the morgue even as relatives of the man pleaded with them to release the body. In the presence of the police contingent, the body was shifted to the morgue even as students threw stones at the policemen who used force to disperse them.

Students turn ire on police after finding man’s body in sump
title: Violence erupts on Osmania varsity campus
